intro: Lobelia georgiana, commonly known as the Georgia lobelias, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Lobelia georgiana is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
